content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
import Base.sort
import Statistics

function find(arr::Array)
    sort!(arr, rev=true)
    n = length(arr)
    
    if n % 2 == 0
        median1 = arr[n รท 2]
        median2 = arr[(n รท 2) + 1]
        return (median1 + median2) / 2
    else
        return arr[div(n+1, 2)]
    end
end
```
This function first sorts the input array in descending order and then finds the middle element or elements in case of an even-sized array. If the array size is odd, it returns the middle value directly. For an even-sized array, it calculates the average of the two middle values to find the median.

Example:
```julia
arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
median_value = find(arr)
println("The median value is ", median_value)
```
